page.title: 11DOMESTIC LIFE.BILSDALE.
page.content: Having gone through the usual organised chaos of getting children ready and taxied to school,the day was mine: or so I thought!I carried on to do the shopping in Stokesley. The fresh fruit and vegetables from the market stalls were worth going for. After dinner,I cut the grass in the front garden, before taking some eggs to a neighbour.On my return, the children were coming home, hungry for tea as usual. Another stretch of grass was cut before I took the two older girls and their friend to a Girl Guide night. When I got home it was straight out again as the two younger ones had a Brownie party.It was 9.30pm when we all got home,and I wondered if the day had been mine at all.
